article:
'Canadian citizenship' is typically obtained by birth in Canada, birth abroad
when at least one parent is a Canadian citizen and was born or naturalized in
Canada, or by adoption abroad by at least one Canadian citizen. It can also be
granted to a permanent resident who has lived in Canada for 1095 days during the
four years prior to applying, can function in the English or French language and
passes a Canadian knowledge test. Details and exceptions to these general rules
are explained below.
categories: Canada and the Commonwealth of Nations
headings: Judicial review of provisions of current and previous citizenship acts
